summary: Liquid Glass is Apple's most significant visual update since iOS 7 in 2013 . Curved elements, translucent buttons, and animated interactions mark a departure from the sharp corners of older versions . Apple did not provide a timeline for Siri overhaul powered by Apple Intelligence .  Some new AI tools were shown like live phone call translations and ChatGPT image analysis integration but analysts said they fell short of rival offerings from OpenAI or Google . Apple also announced a shift in software version names, moving from iOS 18 to iOS 26 .

Warren Buffett had a rare one-on-one with Apple co-founder Steve Jobs in 2012 . Buffett shared a surprising weekend phone call he received "one Saturday" from Jobs himself . Jobs opened with a now-iconic question: "We've got all this cash. What should we do with it?" Buffett said .  Buffett asked Jobs what he could do with his money if he thought Apple stock was undervalued . Jobs ruled out acquisitions, Buffett said: "What better can you do with your money?" Jobs passed away in 2011, and Apple began a massive buyback program in 2012 .  By 2025, Apple is Berkshire Hathaway's largest holding, with about 300 million shares in the portfolio . Even after trimming the position in 2024, it still makes up roughly a quarter of Berkshire's equity investments .  Oracle of Omaha: "Nobody but Steve could have created Apple, but nobody but Tim could have developed it like it has" If Jobs had listened back then, Apple might've gotten a head start on making shareholders very, very happy .  Warren Buffett said Apple's Steve Jobs asked, What Should We Do With 'All This Cash'? Then did nothing after Buffett Told him what to do .

During the past month, Apple's share price experienced a modest 1.47% increase . This movement aligns closely with the general market trends, such as the gains in the S&P 500 and Nasdaq . Apple recently unveiled enhancements across its product lines during its June announcements .  Apple's total shareholder return, including share price and dividends, was 141.68% over the past five years . Over the past year, Apple's return has lagged behind the broader US market's performance . Forward-looking initiatives, such as the upcoming U.S. facility expansion and iPhone 16E launch, are expected to drive efficiencies and contribute to future revenue growth .  The ongoing product advancements and strategic investments aim to bolster Apple's competitive position, aligning with analysts' projections of a revenue increase to US$473.5 billion by 2028 . External factors such as trade policy and legal challenges pose risks to these forecasts .  Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned . Companies discussed in this article include Apple . NasdaqGS:AAPL. This article was originally published bySimply Wall St.

Apple announced updates to its AI models that power its suite of features across iOS, MacOS, iOS, and more . But according to the company's own benchmarks, the models underperform older models from rival tech firms, including OpenAI .  Apple's AI capabilities in recent years have failed to catch up with competitors . Some customers have sued Apple, accusing the firm of marketing AI features for its products that it hasn't delivered .  Apples-upgraded AI models "underwhelm" on performance . The new training dataset includes image data, PDFs, documents, manuscripts, infographics, tables, and charts .

Apple's announcements at its annual developer conference were mainly related to software and software . Apple's developer conference announcements were mainly software and hardware related to its software software .

Apple's developer community has been under fire in recent years . The tech giant has fought against regulation, lawsuits, and attempts to rein in its alleged App Store monopoly . It has yet to deliver on some of the key technology advances that could modernize the App Store .  At WWDC, Apple scattered mentions of AI related to features that Google's AI already has . Apple's AI-powered Visual Intelligence feature was even demonstrated by tapping into Google's app for image search results . Elsewhere, Apple appeased developers' demand for AI with further integrations with OpenAI technology .  No deals with other AI providers were announced . Apple also made scripting and automations appShortcuts easier to use with the addition of AI features . Apple didn't spend time talking about how its App Store is the best place to build an app business .  Apple missed a chance to surprise its developer community with some sort of acknowledgement that it's understood that these past years have been tough, but ultimately it's on developers' sides . Apple also launched a standalone Games app, but the keynote address focused on the consumer benefits .  Apple's App Store opens up to its Search page by default in iOS 26 beta . Apple is pushing developers to spend more on its App Store Search ads for discovery . Other changes point to Apple seeing developers as just another lever to be pulled to make the company more money .  Liquid Glass seems an obvious precursor to building an operating system that will eventually extend beyond smartphones and tablets . Apple's cultural preference for keeping secrets, despite years of comprehensive leaks, kept it from suggesting that Liquid Glass was anything but an updated new look .  Apple's developers say they want to make more iPhones and make consumers happy . This article originally appeared on TechCrunch at http://www.techcrunch.com/2025 .

Apple unveiled the biggest software changes to its line of products in years on Monday . The redesign, which focuses on a new aesthetic Apple calls Liquid Glass, is meant to make the company’s hardware feel new and exciting .  Apple has added Liquid Glass to its iOS software . App icons, menus, and the clock on your phone’s lock screen all have a translucent glass-like look . Apple last overhauled its software in 2013 with iOS 7 .  The Camera app now prominently features just the Photo and Video options, rather than the variety of camera functions in the current app . The new design also cleans up some of the feature bloat that has crept into Apple’s app interfaces over the years .  Apple is changing the naming scheme of its software . Instead of version numbers, the company will now use the year the platform will be most in use . The software updates represent an opportunity to give its products a far more modern look .  iPhone 17, due later this year, will feature a completely new design, including a much thinner body . That, coupled with iOS 26, could help serve as the kind of catalyst Apple needs for a sales bump in 2026 .

Apple's iPad is getting some major upgrades to its operating system . They include upgraded multitasking capabilities that will allow people to use the iPad more like a Mac . The improvements are part of the company's iPadOS 26, which Apple announced during its conference on Monday .  Apple has updated its iPadOS 26 software for the iPad . The company also updated its Files app, so you can navigate saved documents, videos, photos more easily . Apple's iPad segment is its smallest business, bringing in $26.6 billion of the company's $391 billion intotal revenue in 2024 .  Customers looking for more powerful systems will continue to opt for the MacBook Pro . The MacBook Pro has more flexibility than a tablet and is more powerful than a smartphone .

Citi analysts have placed Qorvo and Skyworks Solutions on an "upside 90-day catalyst watch" The outlook is primarily driven by "pulled forward Apple demand due to tariffs" for both companies . Apple accounts for a significant portion of both companies’ total sales .  Citi maintains its "long-term concerns around increasing RF semis competition and concentration risk" for these suppliers . However, the immediate prospect of tariff-driven demand acceleration positions both Qorvo and Skyworks Solutions for potential upside in the near term .

Apple’s Worldwide Developers Conference keynote delivered "slow but steady improvements to strategy," Wedbush analysts said . The event did not provide a specific timeline on AI-powered Siri features that investors had been waiting for . Shares of Apple have lost roughly a fifth of their value in 2025 .  Apple released a software development kit that will allow developers to build apps using the large language models within Apple Intelligence . Goldman Sachs analysts said the lack of Siri updates "may have been underwhelming" Apple shares lost about 1% Monday after the WWDC keynote .  Shares of Apple have struggled this year, falling by roughly a fifth in 2025 amid concerns over the impact of tariffs . Last month, ChatGPT maker OpenAI took what could be seen as a step toward competing with Apple in offering AI devices .

BlackRock Inc., Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and Morgan Stanley are among firms scaling up a strategy known as tax-loss harvesting . When markets drop, managers sell stocks trading below their purchase price to realize losses . Those losses offset gains elsewhere in a portfolio .  Wall Street is leaning more heavily on tax-optimization trades to differentiate offerings, retain clients and defend margins . Automated trading programs scan portfolios daily as equity conditions shift .  In April, BlackRock executed $18 billion in trades that generated $700 million in realized losses . That equated to roughly $5 to $7 in losses realized for every $100 traded that month . Still, even as this year’s selling frenzy created opportunities, the equity rebound that followed highlights a trade-off .  SMA market expected to grow from $3 trillion to $5 trillion by 2027 . Firms layering on increasingly complex techniques to compete, pitched as added-value services . Direct indexing, where investors hold individual stocks directly, has become backbone of this tax-optimization machine .  About 7% of April’s realized losses came from these strategies . Managing tracking error, or how closely a portfolio tracks its benchmark, remains a challenge . IRS wash-sale rule bars investors from buying the same, or substantially identical, securities over a specified timeframe .  Dimensional harvested $20 million in net losses across about 1,400 accounts in April . Parametric, Morgan Stanley’s direct indexing arm, harvested $620 million in losses, generating around $230 million in potential tax benefits . At the height of the volatility, Parametric also introduced an offering with a $25,000 minimum investment .  Goldman Sachs Asset Management is pushing into new customization features to expand its tax-optimized platform . Quant hedge funds such as AQR Capital Management are also in the tax optimization arena . Research shows the biggest benefits tend to accrue to wealthier investors .  Investors can take advantage of volatility when it comes, Parametric's Lee. Parametric’s Lee. Lee. “Taxes represent a headwind for investors to the extent they have to realize gains in taxable accounts.”

Citi maintained their Buy rating on Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) in a note Tuesday, arguing the stock is "set up well" for 2026 . The analysts like the new and "more unified ’Liquid Glass’ design across all platforms" Despite these software advancements, Citi kept its iPhone unit forecasts at "226/234M in 2025/26, or –0.6%/3.2% Y/Y growth"  China's April total smartphone shipment was down 1.6% year-over-year . Foreign mobile phone (mostly iPhone) outperformed by growing 1% y/y . Citi believes that combining this with "aggressive promotions during 618 shopping festival and likely tariffs related pull-in" China iPhone sales could stabilize in the Jun-Q .

Investors may hope that the shares will perform like Nvidia Corp., whose stock soared at the start of the artificial intelligence era .  CoreWeave and Palantir are among this year’s best-performing stocks amid a resurgence of the AI trade . Shares fell 5.8% on Tuesday while PalantIR slipped 0.4% . Cloud-computing provider CoreWeaves tumbled 17% out of the blue, its biggest one-day drop on record .  Palantir trades at 71 times estimated sales, making it by far the most expensive stock in the S&P 500 . CoreWeave's revenue is expected to more than double this year, according to the average of analyst estimates compiled by Bloomberg .  D-Wave Quantum Inc. has jumped 161% from a May low . Nvidia revealed it had a bigger-than-expected stake in CoreWeave last month . Vanda Research has observed rising activity from the retail crowd .  Investors have been burned by these kinds of AI trades before . Super Micro Computer Inc. more than quadrupled last year before a selloff that erased more than 80% of its value . BigBear AI Holdings Inc. and SoundHound AI Inc. delivered strong revenue forecasts in recent quarters .  Apple Inc. unveiled the most sweeping software redesign in its history . Huawei Technologies Co. founder Ren Zhengfei dismissed the impact of US export restrictions on China . Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. reported a 40% jump in May revenue after companies stockpiled chips in response to mounting trade uncertainty . Apple has unveiled iOS 26, its new operating system for the iPhone . The new software includes an all-new transparent design language called Liquid Glass . iOS 26 is also introducing other useful features, including improvements to the way the iPhone handles phone calls .  Apple unveiled iOS 26 at its annual Worldwide Developers Conference on Monday, June 9 . The iOS 26 Developer Beta is available to registered Apple developers . The good news is that anyone can register for theApple Developer Program .  Apple also offers a public Apple Beta Software Program that allows anyone who signs up for it to get early access to beta software . The public beta is updated a few weeks later than the Developer Beta, which means developers get any beta improvements first . Apple won't release iOS 26 to the public until July .  Apple has historically made the general release of the latest iOS available for download in September . The general release is a thoroughly tested piece of software that has (at least in theory) all of the critical bugs fixed and most of the minor bugs, too . Apple (AAPL) has begun to lay out its multi-year artificial intelligence strategy across its strong . Apple has been laying out its plans for artificial intelligence in its new iPhone and iPad lineups .

Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway has nearly 23% of its portfolio invested in two artificial intelligence stocks, Apple and Amazon . Amazon is deploying AI tools and products across its retail and cloud computing businesses . Morgan Stanley views the company as an underappreciated leader .  Apple aims to monetize its installed base exceeding 2.35 billion devices with add-on services like iCloud storage, Apple Care, Apple Pay, and App Store content . Many analysts expect Apple to eventually monetize artificial intelligence .  Siri upgrades have been delayed for months despite many pundits predicting a massive upgrade cycle . Last month, Apple announced plans to open its Apple Intelligence large language models to third-party developers .  The investment thesis for Amazon centers on its strong position in three industries . Wall Street has downwardly revised estimates due to totariff uncertainty . Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the largest public cloud in terms of infrastructure and platform services revenue .  Morgan Stanley recently called Amazon's retail business the "most underappreciated" generative AI beneficiary in the technology space . The company has developed custom semiconductors for AI training and inference that offer better price performance than the leading graphics processing units .  Wall Street estimates Amazon's earnings will increase at 10% annually through 2026 . Amazon beat the consensus estimate by an average of 21% over the last six quarters . I think that trend will continue as investments in AI drive revenue growth and margin expansion . The Worldwide Developers Conference comes around every 12 months, like the Super Bowl or the Oscars . The buzziest elements seemed totally fine. Groundbreaking? No. But cute and user-friendly in the ways we expect from Apple .  Apple’s investors wanted a bit more pizazz . Investors wanted to see Apple make more progress on the souped-up Sirithe company promised last year . In fact, Siri was barely mentioned .  Apple's stock (AAPL) stock tumbled a few minutes into Monday’s event . The company's own AI tech is not living up to its proponents’ biggest promises . Apple also rolled back its AI-powered text message summaries .  Some of the industry’s most advanced AI models face a “complete accuracy collapse” when presented with complex problems . Apple isn’t taking the risk (again!) of getting out over its skis on products that aren't 100% reliable . Analyst: “Cupertino is playing it safe and close to the vest after the missteps last year”  Apple has a track record of taking existing tech and making it popular . Apple was hardly first to smartwatches or tablets, but it now dominates those categories . “We have a high level of confidence Apple can get this right,” analyst says .

Apple has billions of active devices across the globe, which has helped drive revenue of its budding services segment . The combination of hardware, software, and services make up Apple’s powerful ecosystem . Apple's push into AI could improve its overall financial picture .  In Q2 2025, Apple's services division brought in $26.6 billion of revenue, translating to 28% of the company's total . Growth rate is much better than what's being achieved in the more mature products segment . In the future, the share of sales coming from services is likely to expand .  Apple has leveraged its broad distribution, literally sitting in the pockets of consumers worldwide, to layer on services . Services create a key competitive advantage for Apple, which is its powerful ecosystem . Users are essentially locked into theApple's walled garden .  Services are becoming more important from a financial perspective . The vast majority of revenue still comes from hardware . Apple's hope is that Apple Intelligence will spur sales of its devices, incentivizing consumers to update . The $3 trillion stock club isn't a big list; it's just Nvidia, Microsoft and Apple . Amazon is the fourth-largest company in the world, but it is currently valued at around $2.2 trillion . Apple lacks the growth to outperform Nvidia or Microsoft .  The bulk of Nvidia's revenue comes from its data center graphics processing units (GPUs), which have been widely deployed to train and run AI models . Nvidia has a dominant hold on this market, with most estimates stating that Nvidia's market share is greater than 90% .  Next quarter also looks promising for Nvidia, with revenue expected to rise 50% year over year . Part of this slowdown can be attributed to the U.S. government banning exports to China of its H20 chip . Demand for Nvidia's products is expected to persist, with data center buildouts expected to reach $1 trillion by 2028 .  Apple is barely growing and hasn't showcased the ability to release an innovative product for some time . Despite this, it still doesn't trade at much of a discount to the other two from a forward price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio standpoint . With theS&P 500 trading at 22.4 times forward earnings, Apple could have a long way to fall before trading at that level . Apple is one of Warren Buffett's favorite companies . It's the largest position in the Berkshire Hathaway portfolio, accounting for 21.6% of the total . Amazon's AI business presents massive opportunties, and the company's stock is trading at an attractive price .  Many investors know that Buffett loves an undervalued stock . But when explaining how he chooses stocks, he calls himself a business picker, not a stock picker . Buffett: "I didn't go into Apple because it was a tech stock in the least"  Buffett first bought shares of Apple stock in 2016 and built up his position for a few years before selling about half of it last year . When he first bought it, Buffett said that he owned about 5% of shares outstanding but expected that to increase to about 6% to 7% through Apple's share-buyback program .  Amazon's AI business and ambitions are completely different than Apple's . Amazon's greatest AI opportunities are in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud computing segment . Amazon is already seeing massive benefits from investing in AI .  Amazon is the largest e-commerce company in the country, with a strong moat around its leading consumer-goods business . Amazon is heavily investing in the building blocks for developers to create game-changing AI-enabled apps . Amazon's valuation is near its 10-year low .  The Motley Fool’s total average return is792% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to173% for the S&P 500 . Amazon looks like the better buy right now . Apple announced a slew of updates to its operating systems, services, and software . Apple was notably quiet on one highly anticipated product: a more personalized, AI-powered Siri . Apple's SVP of Software Engineering, Craig Federighi, only gave a brief mention during the keynote address .  Apple announced in March it was pushing back the launch of its Siri virtual assistant . The company said Siri would be able to understand your "personal context," like your relationships, communications, routine, and more . The in-development version of Siri was functional but not consistently working properly .  Apple has updated its AI image generation app, Image Playground, to use ChatGPT as well . Apple has also made other AI promises at this year's WWDC, including an AI "Workout Buddy" for Apple Watch .  Still no-ai-powered Siri powered more personalized Siri from Apple, says Siri . Siri is a Siri-powered assistant that works with Siri and other Siri apps .
